coarsermi

Class ObjectRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • coarsermi.ObjectRegistry

  • public class ObjectRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a registry of exported objects on the local machine. This data structure can be shared among more than one ObjectPeer to obtain a multi-peer interoperability.
    Author:
    Salvatore Giampa'

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        public java.lang.String publish(java.lang.Object object,
                                java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Publish the given object respect to the specified interface. The identifier is automatically generated and returned
        Parameters:
        object - the implementation of the service to publish
        remoteIf - the interface of the service to publish
        Returns:
        the generated identifier

      • publish

        public void publish(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.Object object,
                    java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Publish the given object respect to the specified interface.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier to use for this service
        object - the implementation of the service to publish
        remoteIf - the interface of the service to publish
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified identifier was already bound or if the id parameter matches the automatic referencing id pattern that is /\#[0-9]+/

      • unpublish

        public void unpublish(java.lang.Object object,
                      java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Unpublish an object respect to the given interface
        Parameters:
        object - the implementation to unpublish
        remoteIf - the interface respect to unpublish

      • unpublish

        public void unpublish(java.lang.String id)
        Unpublish the service with the specified identifier
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the service

      • attachFailureObserver

        public void attachFailureObserver(FailureObserver o)
        Attach a FailureObserver object.
        Parameters:
        o - the failure observer

      • detachFailureObserver

        public void detachFailureObserver(FailureObserver o)
        Detach a FailureObserver object.
        Parameters:
        o - the failure observer

      • setAutoReferenced

        public void setAutoReferenced(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Marks an interface to automatically create remote references for objects that are sent as arguments for an invocation or as return values. The objects are automatically published on this registry when the related parameter of the stub method has a type that matches with the marked interface
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to mark

      • unsetAutoReferenced

        public void unsetAutoReferenced(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Remove a automatic referencing mark for the interface. See the setAutoReferenced(Class) method. All the objects automatically referenced until this call, remains published in the registry.
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to unmark

      • isAutoReferenced

        public boolean isAutoReferenced(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Check if an interface is marked for automatic referencing. See the setAutoReferenced(Class) method.
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to check
        Returns:
        true if the interface is marked for automatic referencing, false otherwise
